sentence.Network_en: He tried to bluff his way through another test and failed it.
sentence.Network_cn: 他试图再次在考试中蒙混过关，但却露馅了。

sentence.Network_en: Wade was a hearty, bluff, athletic sort of guy.
sentence.Network_cn: 韦德是个精力充沛、率直、运动型的人。

sentence.Network_en: What we're at here is a game of bluff.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们此时陷入的是一场骗局。

jx.jx_en_mean: challenge someone to carry out a stated intention, in the expectation of being able to expose it as a pretence
jx.jx_cn_mean: 戳穿某人的幌子，揭穿某人的谎言

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (originally in the sense 'blindfold, hoodwink'): from Dutch bluffen 'brag', or bluf 'bragging'. The current sense (originally US, mid 19th cent.) originally referred to bluffing in the game of poker
early 18th cent. (in the sense 'surly, abrupt in manner'): figurative use of bluffThe current positive connotation dates from the early 19th cent
early 17th cent. (as an adjective, originally in nautical use): of unknown origin. The Canadian sense dates from the mid 18th cent

entry.tran: 欺骗；误导；吓唬；虚张声势
entry.def: A bluff is an attempt to make someone believe that you will do something when you do not really intend to do it.

example.tran: 这封信不过是吓唬人罢了。

example.ex: It is essential to build up the military option and show that this is not a bluff...
example.tran: 关键是要做好采取军事行动的准备，以表明这不是虚张声势。

entry.tran: （因料到对方不敢行动而）要求…摊牌，接受…的挑战
entry.def: If you call someone's  bluff, you tell them to do what they have been threatening to do, because you are sure that they will not really do it.

example.ex: The Socialists have decided to call the opposition's bluff.
example.tran: 社会党人已经决定接受对方的挑战。

entry.tran: 欺骗；误导；吓唬；虚张声势
entry.def: If you bluff, you make someone believe that you will do something when you do not really intend to do it, or that you know something when you do not really know it.

example.ex: Either side, or both, could be bluffing...
example.tran: 任何一方，或者双方，都可能是在故弄玄虚。

example.ex: In each case the hijackers bluffed the crew using fake grenades...
example.tran: 每一个案例中，劫机者都用了假手榴弹吓唬机组人员。

entry.tran: （尤指河边或海边的）悬崖，峭壁，陡岸
entry.def: A bluff is a steep cliff or bank, especially by a river or the sea.

example.ex: ...a high bluff over the Congaree River.
example.tran: 康加里河边高耸的峭壁

entry.def: If you describe someone, usually a man, as bluff, you mean that they have a very direct way of speaking and behaving.

example.ex: He comes across as a man with a bluff exterior who, beyond that, is difficult to get to know...
example.tran: 他给人感觉是一个直来直去的人，但内心却让人捉摸不透。

example.ex: He has continued to write with a bluff, vivid humour about Yorkshire life.
example.tran: 他继续用一种直白而又诙谐生动的笔触描绘着约克郡的生活。

means.word_mean: 1. a high steep bank (usually formed by river erosion)
2. pretense that your position is stronger than it really is;

sentences.sentence: "his bluff succeeded in getting him accepted"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of bluffing in poker; deception by a false show of confidence in the strength of your cards
1. deceive an opponent by a bold bet on an inferior hand with the result that the opponent withdraws a winning hand
2. frighten someone by pretending to be stronger than one really is
1. very steep; having a prominent and almost vertical front;

sentences.sentence: "where the bold chalk cliffs of England rise"

means.word_mean: 2. bluntly direct and outspoken but good-natured;

auth_sentence.content: Call his bluff and say you're moving out.
auth_sentence.res_content: Call his bluff and say you're moving out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Call his bluff and say you're moving out.

auth_sentence.content: The man was rational enough to call his bluff.
auth_sentence.res_content: The man was rational enough to call his bluff.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The man was rational enough to call his bluff.

auth_sentence.content: His Milton week made him suspect a monstrous bluff.
auth_sentence.res_content: His Milton week made him suspect a monstrous bluff.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His Milton week made him suspect a monstrous bluff.

sentences.en: He says he'll win the race, but he's only bluffing.
sentences.cn: 他说他会赢得这场比赛, 事实上只是在吹牛。

means.word_mean: 以虚张声势找出或达成

sentences.en: He could bluff his way through any difficulty.
sentences.cn: 他可以招摇撞骗闯过任何难关。

sentences.en: It is not easy to climb a bluff mountain.
sentences.cn: 登上陡峭的山可不容易。

means.word_mean: 直率的, 爽快的, 粗率的

sentences.en: He has a bluff way of speaking, but a kind heart.
sentences.cn: 他说话直率, 但心地善良。

jushi.english: He says he'll win the race,but he's only bluffing.
jushi.chinese: 他说他会赢得这场比赛，事实上只是在吹牛。

jushi.english: He could bluff his way through any difficulty.
jushi.chinese: 他可以招摇撞骗闯过任何难关。
